user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_commitattr:
```c
static int lfs_commitattr(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    lfs_mdir_t cwd;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }

    uint16_t id = lfs_tag_id(tag);
    if (id == 0x3ff) {
        // special case for root
        id = 0;
        int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &cwd, lfs->root);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    return lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &cwd, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_USERATTR + type, id, size), buffer}));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_commitattr:
typedef struct lfs_mdir {
    lfs_block_t pair[2];
    uint32_t rev;
    lfs_off_t off;
    uint32_t etag;
    uint16_t count;
    bool erased;
    bool split;
    lfs_block_t tail[2];
} lfs_mdir_t
...
typedef int32_t lfs_stag_t
...
typedef uint32_t lfs_size_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &cwd, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_USERATTR + type, id, size), buffer}));
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown code: the local parameter is declared as const void *buffer and is passed through LFS_MKATTRS. This complies with Rule 8.13 provided that the attribute macro/ lfs_dir_commit ultimately accept a pointer to const. A specific violation would occur if the attribute entry type or lfs_dir_commit prototype expected a non-const pointer (e.g. void *), which would discard the const qualifier when passing buffer and thus violate Rule 8.13.
